title: So Long 2025, Hello 2026! | Daily Digest Evening Edition | theeastsiderla.com
text:
Hello Wednesday!
Here's the latest from TheEastsiderLA.com.
Happy New Year! ðŸŽ‰ Weâ€™re kicking off 2026 with gratitude for all of you â€” thanks for reading, sharing and being part of this community.
Weâ€™ll be taking a short break and going dark on Thursday and Friday, but donâ€™t worry â€” weâ€™ll be back in your inbox first thing Monday.
Now on to today's news.

ðŸ“· Eastside Scene
Griffith Parkâ€”A hiker and equestrians share the trail on a Sunday morning in Oak Canyon. Thanks to Kat Louyse for sharing the photo.
Go here to share your neighborhood photos or reply to this newsletter with your photo and details about the image. You can also tag your Instagram photos with #theeastsiderla.
ðŸ“¢ News
Shooting leaves one dead, three wounded
East Los Angelesâ€”A 31-year-old man was fatally shot and three other men were wounded during a shooting Tuesday night in East Los Angeles. The Eastsider
15-year-old reported missing
East L.A.â€”Detectives from the Los Angeles County Sheriffs' Department are asking for the public's help locating a missing 15-year-old who was last seen in East Los Angeles. The Eastsider
SPONSORED BY CALTECH
Caltech Watson Lecture - Lead Contamination,
From Cars to Fires
Fifty years after a Caltech professor showed dangerous levels of lead in gasoline and paints, another is investigating lead contamination from the 2025 LA fires. Join professor of geochemistry Francois Tissot at his Watson Lecture as he draws a line from the past to the present and shares the impact of his findings on toxic metals in the aftermath of the fires. Free and open to the public
- Free and open to the public
- Wednesday, January 21, 2026, 7:30 p.m.
- Caltechâ€™s Beckman Auditorium
â€ºâ€ºâ€ºâ€ºâ€º Register Here
EAGLE ROCK
The price paid by Rose-loving travelers
Witnessing the pageantry of the Tournament of Roses Parade and Rose Bowl often comes with a steep cost for out-of-town guests â€“ which can mean more revenue for Eagle Rock motels near Pasadena.
Eagle Rock motel owners located on or near the famed Colorado Boulevard have holiday rates that reflect travelers' demand for accommodations close to the parade route and football game.
Hereâ€™s a quick survey of the cost for renting a room for December 31 (not including taxes) at local lodging going west to east. Champagne not included.
- Regency Inn (two queen beds) 2378 Colorado Blvd. $299
- The Hills Inn Eagle Rock (one king bed) 2300 Colorado Blvd. $480.
- The Welcome Inn (one king bed) 1840 Colorado Blvd. $300 + $5 a day parking.
- Islander Hotel (queen bed suite) 1460 Colorado Boulevard. $100.
- Eagle Rock Motel (one king bed) 7041 N. Figueroa. $207.
Two motels -- Casa Lu-An and the Rosebowl Motel -- have no openings for New Yearâ€™s Eve.
Prefer a house instead of a motel? Airbnb showed just one New Yearâ€™s Eve listing available â€” $1,000 for a single night, behind the Eagle Rock Plaza.
Happy New Year!
ðŸ‘ðŸ‘Ž Eastsider Reader Poll
Last time we asked: How would you describe 2025?
And readers responded:
Some of your comments:
â€œWe had a year that started with fire, then we got invaded and occupied by our own National Guard. Every day another ICE raid, with our loved ones disappearing. More than exhausting. Horrible.â€
â€œSo much going on locally, nationally and internationally, itâ€™s hard to take it all in.â€
â€œIt was a demanding year from start to finish. A lot of work, a lot of uncertainty, and a lot of resilience required.â€
â€œI am new to LA, and I have embraced the lifestyle that comes with being here.â€
Editorâ€™s Note: No one selected the fourth option, â€œBetter than expected.â€ May the next year make up for the last one. Speaking of whichâ€¦.
How do you feel about New Year's Resolutions?
The results and comments will be published in a future Eastsider Newsletter.
ðŸ—’ï¸ Notebook
Teen and dog fight cancer together
East Hollywoodâ€”A teenage boy and a 10-year-old therapy dog bonded instantly at Childrenâ€™s Hospital Los Angeles, as they went through cancer treatment together. As 14-year-old Truman successfully battled leukemia, he would spend his Saturdays with Hogan, a golden retriever that had been diagnosed with cancer weeks before Truman had. â€œThey were instant soulmates,â€ said Trumanâ€™s mother. â€œWe have dogs at homeâ€”and that connection is not like this.â€ Newswise
Metro solicits community feedback for proposed 8-mile river path
Elysian Valleyâ€”Metro is seeking public comment for the draft environmental impact report on a proposed eight-mile bike and walking path along the LA River between Elysian Valley and Maywood through downtown Los Angeles and Vernon. Public hearings include Jan. 21 in Lincoln Heights and Jan. 31 in Boyle Heights. The Eastsider
How guaranteed incomes helped community college students
East Hollywoodâ€”A year ago, L.A. community colleges gave about 250 students a guaranteed income of $1,000 a month. Now that those payments have recently ended, how have things worked out for the students? â€œIâ€™m so close,â€ said LACC student Adriana Orea about her goal of becoming a a registered nurse. â€œI canâ€™t wait to be in there.â€ LAist
